CatDescriptText: Mrs. Stella W. Carr, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?" Answer reads: "Christ died for all, therefore we have our choice of religion.  This is America and we should have free worship."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Stella W. Carr wearing plush coat, gloves, knitted hat with dark stripe, and eyeglasses, holding straps of handbag, standing in front of the Empire Building, Jenkins Arcade in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
